summary.span: 提供一组为编译器提供支持的静态方法和属性。

span.span: Provides a set of static methods and properties that provide support for compilers.

summary.span: 无法继承此类。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法可靠地设置句柄。The following example shows how to reliably set handles by using the method. 若要可靠地将句柄设置为指定的预先存在的句柄，必须确保在 对象中分配本机句柄和该句柄的后续记录是原子的。To reliably set a handle to a specified pre-existing handle, you must ensure that the allocation of the native handle and the subsequent recording of that handle within a object is atomic. 这些操作（如线程中止或内存不足异常）之间的任何故障都将导致本机句柄泄露。Any failure between these operations (such as a thread abort or out-of-memory exception) will result in the native handle being leaked. 您可以使用 方法确保句柄不会泄漏。You can use the method to make sure that the handle is not leaked. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/vb/sample.vb#1)]

summary.span: 确保剩余的堆栈控件足够大，可以执行一般的 .NET Framework 函数。

span.span: Ensures that the remaining stack space is large enough to execute the average .NET Framework function.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供有关人为有限的堆栈的信息，该堆栈为引发异常和执行恢复操作保留足够的空间。 provides information about an artificially limited stack that preserves enough space for an exception to be raised and recovery action to be taken. 公共语言运行时选择人工堆栈限制，以确保有足够的空间来安全地引发异常。The artificial stack limit is chosen by the common language runtime to ensure that enough space remains to throw an exception safely. 此方法在发生堆栈溢出的情况下很有用，因为它会导致无限递归。This method is useful in situations where stack overflow might occur as a result of unbounded recursion. 它适用于编译器服务方案，但也可在其他开发方案中安全地使用。It is intended for use in compiler services scenarios, although it can also be used safely in other development scenarios. 如果堆栈空间足够，则不会引发异常，并且仍可以调用大多数 .NET Framework 类型和成员。If the stack space is sufficient, the exception is not thrown, and most .NET Framework types and members can still be called. > [!NOTE] > 此方法不是受约束的执行区域（CER）支持的一部分，不应与 方法混淆。This method is not part of the constrained execution region (CER) support, and should not be confused with the method.

exception.span: 可用堆栈空间不足，无法执行一般的 .NET Framework 函数。

span.span: The available stack space is insufficient to execute the average .NET Framework function.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int GetHashCode (object o);
.method public static hidebysig int32 GetHashCode(object o) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetHashCode (o As Object) As Integer
public: static int GetHashCode(System::Object ^ o);
static member GetHashCode : obj -> int

param.name: o
param.span: 要检索其哈希代码的对象。

span.span: An object to retrieve the hash code for.

summary.span: 用作特定对象的哈希函数，适合在使用哈希代码的算法和数据结构（如哈希表）中使用。

span.span: Serves as a hash function for a particular object, and is suitable for use in algorithms and data structures that use hash codes, such as a hash table.

returns.span: 参数标识的对象的哈希代码。

span.span: A hash code for the object identified by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 即使对象的类型已经重写了 方法， 方法也始终以非虚拟方式调用 方法。The method always calls the method non-virtually, even if the object's type has overridden the method. 因此，使用 可能不同于在 方法的对象上直接调用 `GetHashCode`。Therefore, using might differ from calling `GetHashCode` directly on the object with the method. > [!WARNING] > 尽管 方法返回相同的对象引用的相同哈希代码，但不应使用此方法来测试对象标识，因为此哈希代码不唯一地标识对象引用。Although the method returns identical hash codes for identical object references, you should not use this method to test for object identity, because this hash code does not uniquely identify an object reference. 若要测试对象标识（即，若要测试两个对象是否引用内存中的同一对象），请调用 方法。To test for object identify (that is, to test that two objects reference the same object in memory), call the method. 您也不应使用 来测试两个字符串是否表示相等的对象引用，因为该字符串会被暂存。Nor should you use to test whether two strings represent equal object references, because the string is interned. 若要测试字符串的暂留，请调用 方法。To test for string interning, call the method. 和 方法的区别如下：The and methods differ as follows: - 返回基于对象的相等性定义的哈希代码。 returns a hash code that is based on the object's definition of equality. 例如，两个具有相同内容的字符串将为 返回相同的值。For example, two strings with identical contents will return the same value for . - 返回指示对象标识的哈希代码。 returns a hash code that indicates object identity. 也就是说，两个字符串变量的内容完全相同，并且表示留用的字符串（请参阅[字符串暂存](#interning)部分），或表示内存中的单个字符串返回相同的哈希代码的两个字符串变量。That is, two string variables whose contents are identical and that represent a string that is interned (see the [String Interning](#interning) section) or that represent a single string in memory return identical hash codes. > [!IMPORTANT] > 请注意， 始终为相等对象引用返回相同的哈希代码。Note that always returns identical hash codes for equal object references. 但是，反之亦然：相等的哈希代码不表示相等的对象引用。However, the reverse is not true: equal hash codes do not indicate equal object references. 特定的哈希代码值对于特定的对象引用不是唯一的;不同的对象引用可生成相同的哈希代码。A particular hash code value is not unique to a particular object reference; different object references can generate identical hash codes. 此方法由编译器使用。This method is used by compilers. ## 字符串暂存String Interning 公共语言运行时（CLR）维护字符串的内部池，并将文本存储在池中。The common language runtime (CLR) maintains an internal pool of strings and stores literals in the pool. 如果两个字符串（例如 `str1` 和 `str2`）是从相同的字符串文本组成的，则 CLR 会将 `str1` 和 `str2` 设置为指向托管堆上的相同位置，以节省内存。If two strings (for example, `str1` and `str2`) are formed from an identical string literal, the CLR will set `str1` and `str2` to point to the same location on the managed heap to conserve memory. 对这两个字符串对象调用 将生成相同的哈希代码，与上一部分中的第二个项目符号项相反。Calling on these two string objects will produce the same hash code, contrary to the second bulleted item in the previous section. CLR 仅向池添加文本。The CLR adds only literals to the pool. 字符串操作的结果（如串联）不会添加到池中，除非编译器将该字符串串联解析为单个字符串文本。Results of string operations such as concatenation are not added to the pool, unless the compiler resolves the string concatenation as a single string literal. 因此，如果 `str2` 是作为串联操作的结果创建的，并且 `str2` 与 `str1`相同，则对这两个字符串对象使用 将不会生成相同的哈希代码。Therefore, if `str2` was created as the result of a concatenation operation, and `str2` is identical to `str1`, using on these two string objects will not produce the same hash code. 如果要将连接的字符串显式添加到池中，请使用 方法。If you want to add a concatenated string to the pool explicitly, use the method. 你还可以使用 方法来检查字符串是否有暂存引用。You can also use the method to check whether a string has an interned reference. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 和 方法之间的差异。The following example demonstrates the difference between the and methods. 该示例的输出说明了以下内容：The output from the example illustrates the following: - 传递给 `ShowHashCodes` 方法的第一组字符串的两个哈希代码集是不同的，因为这些字符串完全不同。Both sets of hash codes for the first set of strings passed to the `ShowHashCodes` method are different, because the strings are completely different. - 为传递到 `ShowHashCodes` 方法的第二组字符串生成相同的哈希代码，因为字符串相等。 generates the same hash code for the second set of strings passed to the `ShowHashCodes` method, because the strings are equal. 但 方法不会。However, the method does not. 第一个字符串是使用字符串文字定义的，因此会被暂存。The first string is defined by using a string literal and so is interned. 尽管第二个字符串的值相同，但不会暂留，因为它是通过调用 方法返回的。Although the value of the second string is the same, it is not interned, because it is returned by a call to the method. - 对于第三个字符串， 为这两个字符串生成的哈希代码都是相同的，因为 生成的哈希代码。In the case of the third string, the hash codes produced by for both strings are identical, as are the hash codes produced by . 这是因为编译器已将分配给这两个字符串的值视为单个字符串文本，因此字符串变量引用相同的暂存字符串。This is because the compiler has treated the value assigned to both strings as a single string literal, and so the string variables refer to the same interned string. [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetHashCode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.compilerservices.runtimehelpers.gethashcode/cs/gethashcodeex1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetHashCode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.compilerservices.runtimehelpers.gethashcode/vb/gethashcodeex1.vb#1)]

span.span: The value type to be boxed.

summary.span: 将值类型装箱。

span.span: Boxes a value type.

returns.span: 如果 是一个值类，则返回其装箱的副本；否则返回 本身。

span.span: A boxed copy of if it is a value class; otherwise, itself.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对值类型进行装箱会创建一个对象，并在新对象中执行指定值类型字段的浅表复制。Boxing a value type creates an object and performs a shallow copy of the fields of the specified value type into the new object. 此方法允许将值类作为对象进行操作，同时保留值类的别名行为。This method allows a value class to be manipulated as an object while it retains the aliasing behavior of a value class. 返回值取决于值类是可变还是不可变：The return value depends on whether the value class is mutable or immutable: - 如果所赋的值是可变值类，则该方法将返回类的浅表副本，因为值类具有复制语义。If the value being assigned is a mutable value class, the method returns a shallow copy of the class, because value classes have copy semantics. - 如果分配的值是不可变的值类，则该方法将返回对象本身，而不是类的副本。If the value being assigned is an immutable value class, the method returns the object itself, instead of a copy of the class. 动态类型化语言的编译器可以使用此方法确保装箱值类型的工作方式与取消装箱值类型相同。Compilers of dynamically typed languages can use this method to make sure that boxed value types work identically to unboxed value types. 也就是说，当您传递装箱值类型时，这些值类型会进行克隆，并且它们始终按值传递。That is, boxed value types get cloned when you pass them around, and they are always passed by value. 编译器可以调用 将值类型分配给对象，或将值类型作为类型对象的参数进行传递。The compiler can call to assign a value type to an object or to pass a value type as a parameter of a type object. 此方法由编译器使用。This method is used by compilers. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法对值类进行分类。The following example demonstrates how to box a value class by using the method. [!code-csharp[Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue/vb/example.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取给定字符串中数据的偏移量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the offset, in bytes, to the data in the given string.

value.span: 字节偏移量，从 对象的起始位置到字符串中的第一个字符。

span.span: The byte offset, from the start of the object to the first character in the string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器将此属性用于对托管字符串中的字符执行不安全的指针操作。Compilers use this property for unsafe, but efficient, pointer operations on the characters in a managed string. 编译器应在使用之前固定字符串，以防止垃圾回收器移动。Compilers should pin the string against movement by the garbage collector before use. 请注意，公共语言运行时字符串是不可变的;也就是说，可以读取但不能更改其内容。Note that common language runtime strings are immutable; that is, their contents can be read but not changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PrepareConstrainedRegions ();

Public Shared Sub PrepareConstrainedRegions ()
public: static void PrepareConstrainedRegions();
static member PrepareConstrainedRegions : unit -> unit

summary.span: 将代码体指定为受约束的执行区域 (CER)。

span.span: Designates a body of code as a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用此方法将 `catch`、`finally`和 `fault` 块标记为受约束的执行区域（Cer）。Compilers use this method to mark `catch`, `finally`, and `fault` blocks as constrained execution regions (CERs). 标记为受约束区域的代码必须仅调用具有强可靠性协定的其他代码。Code that is marked as a constrained region must only call other code with strong reliability contracts. 除非已准备好处理故障，否则不应将其分配到或不可靠的方法进行虚拟调用。It should not allocate or make virtual calls to unprepared or unreliable methods unless it is prepared to handle failures. 请注意，在对 方法和 `try` 块的调用之间，不允许除 `NOP`之外的任何中间语言操作码。Note that no intermediate language opcodes, except `NOP`, are allowed between a call to the method and the `try` block. 有关 Cer 的详细信息，请参阅 命名空间中的类。For more information about CERs, see the classes in the namespace. 当从 `try` 块生成 时，使用 方法标记的 Cer 不能正常工作。CERs that are marked using the method do not work perfectly when a is generated from the `try` block. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method. 方法调用 方法。The method calls the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法可靠地设置句柄。The following example shows how to reliably set handles by using the method. 若要可靠地将句柄设置为指定的预先存在的句柄，必须确保在 对象中分配本机句柄和该句柄的后续记录是原子的。To reliably set a handle to a specified pre-existing handle, you must ensure that the allocation of the native handle and the subsequent recording of that handle within a object is atomic. 这些操作（如线程中止或内存不足异常）之间的任何故障都将导致本机句柄泄露。Any failure between these operations (such as a thread abort or out-of-memory exception) will result in the native handle being leaked. 您可以使用 方法确保句柄不会泄漏。You can use the method to make sure that the handle is not leaked. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/vb/sample.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 将代码体指定为受约束的执行区域 (CER)，无需执行任何探测。

span.span: Designates a body of code as a constrained execution region (CER) without performing any probing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器不应直接调用此方法。Compilers should not call this method directly. 而是通过调用 方法来定义 CER。Instead, define a CER by calling the method.

public: static void PrepareContractedDelegate(Delegate ^ d);
static member PrepareContractedDelegate : Delegate -> unit

span.span: The event delegate to prepare.

summary.span: 提供应用程序用来动态准备 事件委托的方法。

span.span: Provides a way for applications to dynamically prepare event delegates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件委托，如 、和 在启动时不会自动准备。 event delegates such as , , and are not automatically prepared at startup. 您可以使用以下方法来准备它们：You can use the following methods to prepare them: - 使用 特性为方法特性。Attribute the method by using the attribute. - 使用 特性为方法特性。Attribute the method by using the attribute. - 调用 方法以动态准备委托。Call the method to dynamically prepare the delegate. 有关详细信息，请参阅 MSDN 杂志中的文章[使你的代码在运行时具有 .NET Framework 的可靠性功能](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145491)。For more information, see the article [Keep Your Code Running with the Reliability Features of the .NET Framework](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145491) in the MSDN Magazine.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PrepareDelegate (Delegate d);
.method public static hidebysig void PrepareDelegate(class System.Delegate d) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareDelegate (d As Delegate)
public: static void PrepareDelegate(Delegate ^ d);
static member PrepareDelegate : Delegate -> unit

span.span: The delegate type to prepare.

summary.span: 指示应准备指定委托以包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中。

span.span: Indicates that the specified delegate should be prepared for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用此方法来准备委托的调用方法，并将该调用的目标（以及委托的可静态可为的调用关系图）准备为受约束的执行区域（CER）。Compilers use this method to prepare a delegate's invocation method and to prepare the target of that invocation (and the delegate's statically determinable call graph) as a constrained execution region (CER).

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PrepareMethod (RuntimeMethodHandle method);
.method public static hidebysig void PrepareMethod(valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle method) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareMethod (method As RuntimeMethodHandle)
public: static void PrepareMethod(RuntimeMethodHandle method);
static member PrepareMethod : RuntimeMethodHandle -> unit

span.span: A handle to the method to prepare.

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用 方法来处理在受约束的执行区域（CER）内进行的虚拟调用。Compilers use the method to handle virtual calls that are made inside a constrained execution region (CER). 在 JIT 编译时，公共语言运行时通常不具有关于虚拟调用目标的足够信息。At JIT compilation time, the common language runtime does not usually have enough information about the target of a virtual call. 因此，运行时最初不准备调用关系图的这一段。Therefore, the runtime does not initially prepare that segment of the call graph. 如果使用 CER 的代码有足够的知识来确定在实际输入 CER 之前的任何时间点，则它可以调用 来执行通常为在指定为参数的方法中的 CER 执行相同的运行时准备。If the code that is using the CER has enough knowledge to determine the target at any point in time before the CER is actually entered, it can call to perform the same runtime preparation normally done for a CER rooted at the method specified as an argument.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PrepareMethod (RuntimeMethodHandle method, RuntimeTypeHandle[] instantiation);
.method public static hidebysig void PrepareMethod(valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle method, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] instantiation) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareMethod (method As RuntimeMethodHandle, instantiation As RuntimeTypeHandle())
public: static void PrepareMethod(RuntimeMethodHandle method, cli::array <RuntimeTypeHandle> ^ instantiation);
static member PrepareMethod : RuntimeMethodHandle * RuntimeTypeHandle[] -> unit

span.span: A handle to the method to prepare.

param.name: instantiation
param.span: 要传递给该方法的实例化。

span.span: The instantiation to pass to the method.

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的具有指定实例化的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER) with the specified instantiation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以通过使用 方法为编译器提供泛型支持。You can provide generics support for compilers by using the method. 当这些类型参数被实例化为引用类型时，公共语言运行时无法在具有泛型类型参数的方法（在包含方法的类上的类型参数或方法本身上的类型参数）中准备根的约束的执行区域（Cer）。The common language runtime cannot prepare constrained execution regions (CERs) rooted in a method that has generic type parameters (either a type parameter on the class containing the method or one on the method itself) when those type parameters are instantiated as reference types. 您可以使用此重载传递特定实例化（如类型数组），指定类类型参数（如果有），后跟方法类型参数（如果有）。You can use this overload to pass a specific instantiation (such as an array of types), specifying class type parameters first (if any), followed by method type parameters (if any). 运行时准备方法的实例化。The runtime prepares that instantiation of the method. （仅当你使用的实例化至少包含一个引用类型参数时，才需要此项。）因此，可以在泛型方法（或泛型类中的非泛型方法）中使用 CER 样式的 `try` 子句，并且它可以与 或其他值类型的实例化可靠地一起工作。(This is necessary only if the instantiations you use contain at least one reference type parameter.) Thus, you can use a CER-style `try` clause in a generic method (or a nongeneric method on a generic class) and it will work reliably with instantiations of or other value types. 若要实例化引用类型（如 ），必须先对 CER 根方法使用显式的 方法。To instantiate reference types such as , you must use an explicit method on the CER root method first.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ProbeForSufficientStack ();
.method public static hidebysig void ProbeForSufficientStack() cil managed
Public Shared Sub ProbeForSufficientStack ()
public: static void ProbeForSufficientStack();
static member ProbeForSufficientStack : unit -> unit

summary.span: 探测某个数量的堆栈空间，以确保不会在后续的代码块内发生堆栈溢出（假设用户的代码仅使用有限适中的堆栈空间）。

span.span: Probes for a certain amount of stack space to ensure that a stack overflow cannot happen within a subsequent block of code (assuming that your code uses only a finite and moderate amount of stack space).

summary.span: 建议使用受约束的执行区域 (CER)，而不使用此方法。

span.span: We recommend that you use a constrained execution region (CER) instead of this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由受约束的执行区域（CER）基础结构在可复原堆栈溢出的主机（如 Microsoft SQL Server 和 Microsoft Exchange Server）中运行时使用。This method is used by the constrained execution region (CER) infrastructure when running in hosts that are resilient to stack overflow such as Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Exchange Server. 此方法当前在 x86 平台上探测 48 KB 的堆栈空间，但确切的数量可能会随时间而变化，并且在其他平台上可能会有所不同。This method currently probes for 48 KB of stack space on the x86 platform, but the exact amount may change over time and may vary on other platforms. 编译器也使用此方法。This method is also used by compilers. 应使用标准 CER，而不是使用 方法。Instead of using the method, you should use a standard CER. 也就是说，如果计划使用适中量的堆栈空间，请在 `try`/`finally` 或 `try`/`catch` 块之前立即调用 方法。That is, if you are planning to use a moderate amount of stack space, call the method immediately before your `try`/`finally` or `try`/`catch` block. 如果要调用递归方法或计划使用大量堆栈空间，则必须使用 方法。If you are calling a recursive method or plan to use a lot of stack space, you must use the method.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

param.name: type
param.span: 类型句柄，用于指定应为其运行类型初始值设定项的类型。

span.span: A type handle that specifies the type for which a type initializer should be run.

summary.span: 确保已运行指定类型的类型初始值设定项（也称为静态构造函数）。

span.span: Ensures that the type initializer (also known as a static constructor) for the specified type has been run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由编译器使用。This method is used by compilers.

exception.span: 类型初始值设定项引发异常。

span.span: The type initializer throws an exception.

span.span: Runs a specified module constructor method.

exception.span: 模块构造函数引发了一个异常。

span.span: The module constructor throws an exception.

summary.span: 尝试确保有足够的堆栈来执行平均 .NET Core 库函数。

span.span: Tries to ensure there is sufficient stack to execute the average .NET Core library function.

returns.span: 如果存在足够的堆栈，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if sufficient stack is present; otherwise, .
